summary.para: Specifies how aggressively a pipeline component should drop samples.

remarks.para: In drop mode, a component drops samples, more or less aggressively depending on the level of the drop mode. The specific algorithm used depends on the component. Mode 1 is the least aggressive mode, and mode 5 is the most aggressive. A component is not required to implement all five levels.
For example, suppose an encoded video stream has three B-frames between each pair of P-frames. A decoder might implement the following drop modes:

description.para: Mode 1: Drop one out of every three B frames.
Mode 2: Drop one out of every two B frames.

remarks.para: The enhanced video renderer (EVR) can drop video frames before sending them to the EVR mixer.

summary.para: Normal processing of samples. Drop mode is disabled.
Fifth drop mode (most aggressive, if it is supported; see Remarks).
Maximum number of drop modes. This value is not a valid flag.
